item.dc:creator: jtang

item.title: API for dri-api
item.description:
Express test server listening on port 4001 in test mode

TOC

  • APIv2 tests
    • GET /
    • POST /dev/collections
    • POST /dev/collections/:id/series
    • POST /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items
    • PUT /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id
    • PUT /dev/collections/:id/series/:id
    • PUT /dev/collections/:id
    • GET /dev/collections
    • GET /dev/collections/:id
    • GET /dev/collections/:id/series
    • GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id
    • GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items
    • GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id
    • DELETE /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id
    • DELETE /dev/collections/:id/series/:id
    • DELETE /dev/collections/:id

APIv2 tests

GET /

should respond with the documentation page. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/'
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, '<title>DRI API</title>');
                done();
            });

POST /dev/collections

should respond with the id of the created collection. 

            request({
                method : 'POST',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections',
                form : {
                    Title : 'Autobot collection'
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                collectionId = body;
                done();
            });

POST /dev/collections/:id/series

should respond with the id of the created series. 

            request({
                method : 'POST',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series',
                form : {
                    Title : 'Autobot series',
                    author : 'Autobot',
                    parentId : collectionId
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                seriesId = body;
                done();
            });

POST /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items

should respond with the id of the created item. 

            request({
                method : 'POST',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId + '/items',
                form : {
                    Title : 'Autobot title',
                    Subtitle : 'Autobot Subtitle',
                    parentId : seriesId
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                itemId = body;
                done();
            });

PUT /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id

should respond with the id of the updated item. 

            request({
                method : 'PUT',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId + '/items/' + itemId,
                form : {
                    _id : itemId,
                    Title : 'Autobot titleUpdate',
                    Subtitle : 'Autobot Subtitle',
                    update : 'update',
                    type : 'item',
                    parentId : seriesId
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });

PUT /dev/collections/:id/series/:id

should respond with the id of the updated series. 

            request({
                method : 'PUT',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId,
                form : {
                    _id : seriesId,
                    Title : 'Autobot seriesUpdate',
                    author : 'Autobot',
                    update : 'update',
                    type : 'series',
                    parentId : collectionId
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });

PUT /dev/collections/:id

should respond with the id of the updated series. 

            request({
                method : 'PUT',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId,
                form : {
                    _id : collectionId,
                    Title : 'Autobot collectionUpdate',
                    type : 'collection',
                    update : 'update'
                }
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections

should respond with an array of all the collections. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections'
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, collectionId);
                assert.include(body, "Autobot collectionUpdate");
                assert.include(body, "update");
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections/:id

should respond with the array containing the data of the specified collection. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                var json = JSON.parse(body);
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.equal(json.Title, "Autobot collectionUpdate");
                assert.equal(json.update, "update");
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections/:id/series

should respond with an array of all the series corresponding to the given id. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series'
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, seriesId);
                assert.include(body, "Autobot seriesUpdate");
                assert.include(body, "update");
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id

should respond with the array containing the data of the specified series. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                var json = JSON.parse(body);
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.equal(json.Title, "Autobot seriesUpdate");
                assert.equal(json.update, "update");
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items

should respond with an array of all the items corresponding to the given ids. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId + '/items'
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, itemId);
                assert.include(body, "Autobot titleUpdate");
                assert.include(body, "update");
                done();
            });

GET /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id

should respond with the array containing the data of the specified item. 

            request({
                method : 'GET',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId + '/items/' + itemId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                var json = JSON.parse(body);
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.isDefined(body);
                assert.equal(json.Title, "Autobot titleUpdate");
                assert.equal(json.update, "update");
                done();
            });

DELETE /dev/collections/:id/series/:id/items/:id

should respond with the id of the deleted item. 

            request({
                method : 'DELETE',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId + '/items/' + itemId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, itemId);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });

DELETE /dev/collections/:id/series/:id

should respond with the id of the deleted series. 

            request({
                method : 'DELETE',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId + '/series/' + seriesId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, seriesId);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });

DELETE /dev/collections/:id

should respond with the id of the deleted collection. 

            request({
                method : 'DELETE',
                uri : socket + '/dev/collections/' + collectionId
            }, function(err, resp, body) {
                assert.isNull(err);
                assert.include(body, collectionId);
                assert.length(body, 24);
                done();
            });
item.dc:creator: jtang

item.title: API for node-fedora
item.description:
TOC

  • Test cases for the node-fedora package
    • createFedoraObject, will create a FedoraObject
    • getFedoraList, Get a list of FedoraObjects
    • getFedoraObject, get a fedoraObject
    • deleteObject, will delete an object from fedora
    • getNextPID, will get the next PID that is available from fedora

Test cases for the node-fedora package

createFedoraObject, will create a FedoraObject

should create a FedoraObject. 

            fedora.createFedoraObject(testNamespace,testLabel, function(result){
                testResult = result;
                result.should.exist;
                result.should.include(testNamespace + ":");
                done();
            });

getFedoraList, Get a list of FedoraObjects

should return a list of FedoraObjects from the fedora repository. 

            fedora.getFedoraList("*",function(resultData){
                resultData.should.exist;
                resultData.should.include('result');
                resultData.should.not.be.empty;
            }, 
            function(error){
                should.not.exist(error);
            });

getFedoraObject, get a fedoraObject

should return a fedoraObject. 

            fedora.getFedoraObject(testResult, function(resultData){
                resultData.should.include(testResult);
                done();
            });

deleteObject, will delete an object from fedora

should delete the requested object from fedora. 

            fedora.deleteObject(testResult, function(resultData){
                var myregexp = new RegExp("[0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}.?[0-9]*Z");
                resultData.should.match(myregexp);
                done();
            }, function(error){
                should.not.exist(error);
            });

getNextPID, will get the next PID that is available from fedora

should return the next PID from fedora. 

            fedora.getNextPID("node", function(resultData){
                resultData.should.include("node:");
                done();
            });
item.dc:creator: jtang

item.title: API for node-dri
item.description:
TOC

  • Test cases for node-dri package
    • Creating a Collection
    • Creating a Series
    • Creating an Item
    • Getting an Item
    • Inserting an Item
    • Getting all children of a parent item
    • Pushing the item into fedora
    • Getting items from a certain type
    • Removing an item and children items
    • Removing a collection and children series and/or items
    • Getting all media files

Test cases for node-dri package

Creating a Collection

should create a collection and return the id of the collection. 

            var data = {};
            data.Title = "AutoTestColl" + rnd;
            data.type = "collection";
            dri.createCollection(data, function(result) {
                result.should.be.ok
                collId = result;
                done();
            }, function(e) {
                should.not.exist(e);
            });

Creating a Series

should create a series and return the id of the series. 

            var data = {
                collection : collId,
                Title : "AutoTestSeries" + rnd,
                author : "AutoBot",
                type : "series"
            };
            dri.createSeries(data, function(result) {
                result.should.be.ok
                seriesId = result;
                done();
            }, function(e) {
                should.not.exist(e);
            });

Creating an Item

should create an Item and return the id of the Item. 

            var data = {
                parentId : seriesId,
                Title : "AutoBotTitle" + rnd,
                Subtitle : "AutoBotSubitle" + rnd,
                objectId : rnd,
                type : "item"
            };
            dri.createItem(data, function(result) {
                result.should.be.ok
                itemId = result;
                done();
            }, function(e) {
                should.not.exist(e);
            });

Getting an Item

should get an Item and return the Item. 

            dri.getItem(itemId, function(result) {
                should.equal(itemId, result._id);
                done();
            }, function(e) {
                should.not.exist(e);
            });

Inserting an Item

Should create the new item, update the position of the other items and return the id of the created item. 

            var data = {
                amount : 10,
                parentId : seriesId,
                objectId : 0,
                Title : "AutoBotTitle" + rnd,
                Subtitle : "AutoBotSubitle" + rnd,
                type : "item"
            };
            for(var i = 0; i < data.amount; i++) {
                data.objectId = data.objectId +i;
                dri.createItem(data, function(result) {
                    result.should.be.ok;
                }, function(e) {
                    should.not.exist(e);
                });
            }
            data.objectId = 3;
            dri.updateIdOrder(data.parentId, data.objectId, 1, function(amount) {
                amount.should.be.a("number");
                dri.createItem(data, function(id) {
                    dri.getItems(seriesId, function(result) {
                        var str = result.length;
                        should.equal(str, 12);
                        done();
                    }, function(e) {
                        should.not.exist(e);
                        done();
                    });
                }, function(e) {
                    should.not.exist(e);
                    done();
                });
            })

Getting all children of a parent item

should get an array of children. 

            dri.getItems(seriesId, function(result) {
                var str = result[0].parentId;
                should.equal(str, seriesId);
                done();
            }, function(e) {
                should.not.exist(e);
                done();
            });

Pushing the item into fedora

should push the item into fedora and return the fedora id from that item. 

            dri.approveItem(itemId, "cfedoraLib", function(pid) {
                pid.should.include(":");
                done();
            }, function(err) {
                should.not.exist(e);
                done();
            });

Getting items from a certain type

should return an array of items from a certain type (here series). 

            dri.getAllRecordsByType("series", function(data) {
                should.equal(data[0].type, "series");
                done();
            });

Removing an item and children items

should return the id of the removed item. 

            dri.removeItem(seriesId, function(id) {
                should.equal(seriesId, id);
                dri.getItems(id, function(result) {
                    var str = result.length;
                    should.equal(0, str);
                }, function(e) {
                    should.not.exist(e);
                });
            }, function(err) {
                should.not.exist(e);
            });

Removing an item and children items

should return the id of the removed item. 

            dri.removeItem(itemId, function(id) {
                should.equal(itemId, id);
                dri.getItems(id, function(result) {
                    var str = result.length;
                    should.equal(0, str);
                }, function(e) {
                    should.not.exist(e);
                });
            }, function(err) {
                should.not.exist(e);

            });

Removing a collection and children series and/or items

should return the id of the removed collection. 


            dri.removeItem(collId, function(id) {
                should.equal(collId, id);
                dri.getItems(id, function(result) {
                    var str = result.length;
                    should.equal(0, str);
                }, function(e) {
                    should.not.exist(e);
                });
            }, function(err) {
                should.not.exist(e);

            });

Getting all media files

should return an array with the media files metadata. 

            dri.getAllMediaItems(function(data) {
                should.exist(data);
                done();
            });
item.dc:creator: jtang

item.title: DRIS Workflows
item.description:
The DRIS Workflows package is a prototype system developed by some interns at TCHPC during the 2012 internship.

Primary authors of DRIS Workflows

  • Matthias.Van.Wambeke@howest.be
  • Quirijn.Groot.Bluemink@howest.be

With help from the TCHPC and DRIS team at TCD.
item.dc:creator: Jimmy Tang
